SharedMem:
["Monica and Rachel are best friends who went to the same schools, live together, and spend most of their time together.",
 "Tonight, Monica goes out with some other friends, and at the restaurant, she unexpectedly sees Rachel dining with her boyfriend."]
ScenarioPremise: When Monica sees Rachel, she says, “Haven't seen you in ages.”
Options:
["To say that she will call her later",
 "To say she has been very busy in the last week",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To laugh at the joke"]
LcGoal: Monica wants to have a fun evening out with friends
LcContext: Monica is surprised to see Rachel out with her boyfriend
LcSpecificMem: Monica is upset because she hasn't seen Rachel in a week
LcExtras: Monica feels amused by seeing her best friend
IlcGoal: Rachel wants to enjoy dinner with her boyfriend
IlcContext: Rachel is surprised to see Monica
IlcSpecificMem: Rachel finds it funny to run into Monica and wants to call her later to tell her about dinner
IlcExtras: Rachel was having a private evening with her boyfriend
Illocutor_answer: To say that she will call her later
